resources.string:
• Leaf spots that have an angular shape and are usually surrounded by yellowing tissue.

• Infected plant tissue or gum patches may enlarge, combine, and ooze out substance.

• Gum is initially golden, later forming amber-colored stains.

• Leaf has a dark green color.

• Firm, fan-shaped leaves.

• There is no uncommon discoloration or spotting on the leaf.

• Cut out infected leaves if only a few leaves show symptoms.

• Debris and weeds around infected plant should be removed and burned or deep buried. 

• Tools should be regularly disinfected using a bactericide.

• Remove leaves showing lesions and blighting.

• Remove and have effective weed management. 

• Keep farming materials clean and always disinfect them.
Before proceeding to the manual, here are some information about this application.
It is an application that can aid in determining if a cassava leaf shows indications of being bacterial blight infected. The word “I-CBB” is a word play for “I SEE Bacterial Blight”.
